stories.text:
Lately I've been paying attention to where I spend time and I've managed to find some low-hanging fruit and optimize some tasks.

Examples like using fish (unix shell), writing shell scripts to automate sequential build commands I'd otherwise have to wait for, learning vim shortcuts and language syntax, implementing reusable utility scripts to produce/consume data.

Do you have recommendations/tips/examples to speed up your processes? Feel free to share even specific instances, they don't have to be as generic as above.
stories.title: Software devs, how have you sped up your workflow?

stories.text: To create and design and engineer an OTT TV Streaming platform to become a Interactive TV Channel using the Json and SDK OTT format architecture. VOD and Real-time interaction with those on the licensed network. Using Intel OBS streaming infrastructure with Intel One API Toolkit and FPGA Technology to produce an Broadcasting TV Network Video Chat service with zero latency. All the above coding infrastructure to be fused into TV API Autonomous streaming platform for interactive live stream Video Programming TVaaS PLatform,. The Data scientist must be able to conform their codes to be streamlined in sync on The ROKU and Amazon Prime TV Network. t.reidy@hotmail.co.uk for feedback

stories.text: I just started Geo Blocking certain countries on my router, and I get over 12000 hits a day from Russia and 1000 from China.
